text:
"This is about the sportsman. For the North Korean politician, see Kim Jong-nam."
Kim Jung-Nam (, Hanja: 金正男, born January 28, 1943) is a South Korean professional athlete. He is best known as an association football player. He was a member of the Korean national team, including the 1964 Summer Olympics.
He was a K-League manager; and he served as K-League Vice President.
